definition: Wei of the Northern Dynasties (386-534), founded by the Tuoba 拓跋 branch of Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑
north/(classical) to be defeated

surname Wei/name of vassal state of Zhou dynasty from 661 BC in Shanxi, one of the Seven Hero Warring States/Wei state, founded by Cao Cao 曹操[Cao2 Cao1], one of the Three Kingdoms after the Han dynasty/the Wei dynasty 221-265/Wei prefecture and Wei county at different historical periods
tower over a palace gateway (old)

sentences.english: Tell me a little about the Northern Wei dynasty and its place in the history of ceramics.
sentences.chinese: 那么请你讲一讲北魏在陶瓷史上的地位。

sentences.english: In recent years, there are some new materials about Northern Wei Dynasty epitaphs unearthed in Luoyang.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，洛阳出土北魏墓志又出现了一些新的材料。

sentences.english: GuangYuan grottoes has already been cut in the later period of Northern Wei Dynasty at the latest.
sentences.chinese: 广元石窟最迟在北魏晚期已有开凿。

sentences.english: The art of cave temples originated in (or from) India and first appeared in China at Dunhuang.
sentences.chinese: 北魏的出现标志着中国艺术与文化一个新的高点。

sentences.english: Discrete tribes on the Northern Wei Dynasty, "Wei Shu" in a total of three records.
sentences.chinese: 关于北魏离散部落，《魏书》中一共有三条记载。

sentences.english: When the Northern Wei Dynasty Qinzhou South East Yizhou Wudu County.
sentences.chinese: 北魏时为南秦州，东益州武都郡。

sentences.english: Datong is the capital of Beiwei Dynasty. And Xiaowendi Emperor move the capital to Luoyang.
sentences.chinese: 大同，是北魏的都城，到孝文帝时才迁都洛阳。

sentences.english: Emperor Tai Wu in Beiwai Dynasty deserves to be a great man.
sentences.chinese: 北魏太武帝是值得称颂的人物。

sentences.english: Buddha Temple was built in Northern Wei Dynasty, and later destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 佛光寺始建于北魏，后来被毁。

definition: the Northern Zhou Dynasty (557-581)/one of the Northern Dynasties
Eastern Wei of the Northern dynasties (534-550), formed from the break-up of Wei of the Northern Dynasties 北魏
Northern Dynasties (386-581)
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
Western Wei of the Northern dynasties (535-557), formed from the break-up of Wei of the Northern Dynasties 北魏
Northern and Southern dynasties (420-589)
Sixteen Kingdoms of Five non-Han people (ruling most of China 304-439)/also written 五胡十六國|五胡十六国
Qi of the Northern Dynasties (550-557)
Northern Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms (398-439)
Western Jin dynasty (265-316)
Xianbei or Xianbi, historic ethnic group of northern nomads
Sui dynasty (581-617)
Southern Dynasties (420-589)
Former Qin of the Sixteen Kingdoms (351-395)
Eastern Jin dynasty 317-420
Later Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (384-409)
